utterances: Well, I started trying to think of any professions that were associated with a specific country and vice versa.

All right, Jared and Sue, I'm going to give you some words and a category.
Name something in the category whose letters can be found in left-to-right order in the word, although not consecutively.
And I'll tell you every answer has five letters.
For example, if I said humanoid and a world capital, you would say Hanoi because Hanoi is a world capital, and it's - those letters are found in left-to-right order in humanoid.
Number one is avenues, and you're looking for a planet.
Number two is biodiesel - B-I-O-D-I-E-S-E-L - biodiesel, and your category is state capital.
Think of a state capital starting with B in five letters.
I know you have the answer.

There you go - coming out, African river.

Take a common English word in three letters.
Translate it into French - also three letters.
And this is a French word everyone knows.
And between them, these two words consist of six different vowels and no consonants.
